title: endless "State heal in progress"
body:
#### System information

Geth version: `v1.10.25`
CL client & version: prysm@v3.1.1
OS & Version: Linux, Ubuntu@22.04.1, kernel@5.15.0-1020-aws

#### Expected behaviour
finished in days

#### Actual behaviour
endless "State heal in progress"

I'm using AWS io2 with provisioned 64000 IOPS volume.  Here's the fio test result:

```
sudo fio -filename=/volumes/delta/geth/test3 -direct=1 -iodepth 1 -thread -rw=randrw -rwmixread=70 -ioengine=psync -bs=16k -size=2G -numjobs=10 -runtime=60 -group_reporting -name=mytest
mytest: (g=0): rw=randrw, bs=(R) 16.0KiB-16.0KiB, (W) 16.0KiB-16.0KiB, (T) 16.0KiB-16.0KiB, ioengine=psync, iodepth=1

fio-3.28
Starting 10 threads
Jobs: 10 (f=10): [m(10)][100.0%][r=273MiB/s,w=116MiB/s][r=17.4k,w=7441 IOPS][eta 00m:00s]
mytest: (groupid=0, jobs=10): err= 0: pid=2997331: Mon Sep 26 03:15:35 2022
  read: IOPS=17.4k, BW=272MiB/s (285MB/s)(14.0GiB/52692msec)
```

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour


#### Backtrace

````
````

When submitting logs: please submit them as text and not screenshots.

Several issues in snap-sync have been fixed in `latest`, a.k.a `develop`. If you are experiencing drawn-out `State heal in progress`, then please try `1.11...` line instead. Either compile from source, or pick a binary from https://geth.ethereum.org/downloads/ .
excuse me ,Have you resolved this issue? @nining

> excuse me ,Have you resolved this issue? @nining

After tens of hours and it finished.  I have not tried 1.11-development-snapshot yet.
